normalised: Rental Agreement Woes? Don't Get Stuck Like Pappu!

unnormalised: Rental Agreement Woes? Don't Get Stuck Like Pappu!
normalised: Mumbai: Renting can be a headache, yaar! Especially when the rental agreement isn't up to scratch. Doctor Sharma, a property lawyer in Bandra, says many folks, like our friend Pappu from Chembur, get caught out by vague clauses.

unnormalised: Mumbai: Renting can be a headache, yaar! Especially when the rental agreement isn't up to scratch. Dr. Sharma, a property lawyer in Bandra, says many folks, like our friend Pappu from Chembur, get caught out by vague clauses.
normalised: "Always double-check the maintenance charges," advises Doctor Sharma. "Is it included in the rupee twenty five thousand rent, or is that extra?"

unnormalised: "Always double-check the maintenance charges," advises Dr. Sharma. "Is it included in the Rs. 25,000 rent, or is that extra?"
normalised: Common issues include unclear rules about guests (can Chintu stay over?), security deposits (rupee fifty thousand a bit steep, no?), and what happens if the building needs repairs (who pays?).

unnormalised: Common issues include unclear rules about guests (can Chintu stay over?), security deposits (Rs. 50,000 a bit steep, no?), and what happens if the building needs repairs (who pays?).
normalised: Got a sweet deal on a one B H K flat measuring six hundred square feet? Awesome! But make sure your agreement clearly states who's responsible for fixing that leaky faucet and the geyser!

unnormalised: Got a sweet deal on a 1BHK flat measuring 600 sq ft? Awesome! But make sure your agreement clearly states who's responsible for fixing that leaky faucet and the geyser!
normalised: Don't just blindly sign. Read every line, ask questions, and maybe even get a lawyer's opinion. Remember, a clear agreement is your best friend. Nobody wants to end up arguing with their landlord over something silly, like replacing a broken tap!

unnormalised: Don't just blindly sign. Read every line, ask questions, and maybe even get a lawyer's opinion. Remember, a clear agreement is your best friend. Nobody wants to end up arguing with their landlord over something silly, like replacing a broken tap!
